greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array where the row n lists all nonnegative numbers k for which A328578(k) = n, read by falling antidiagonals.
comment: Array is read by descending antidiagonals with (n,k) = (1,1), (1,2), (2,1), (1,3), (2,2), (3,1), ... where A(n,k) is the k-th solution x to A328578(x) = n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1081; the first 46 antidiagonals of the array
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
Index entries for sequences related to primorial base
example: The top left 12 X 12 corner of the array:
program: A276086(n) = { my(m=1, p=2); while(n, m *= (p^(n%p)); n = n\p; p = nextprime(1+p)); (m); };
A328631sq(n, k) = { my(v=0); if(!mapisdefined(memoA328631sq,[n,k-1],&v),if(1==k, v=-1, v = A328631sq(n, k-1))); for(i=1+v,oo,if(A328578(i)==n,mapput(memoA328631sq,[n,k],i); return(i))); };
A328631list(up_to) = { my(v = vector(up_to), i=0); for(a=1,oo, for(col=1,a, i++; if(i > up_to, return(v)); v[i] = A328631sq(col,(a-(col-1))))); (v); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 27 2019
